main event: A round, pink-reddish orange object described as a 'large ball of flame' was observed for about 30 seconds over Ardmore, Pennsylvania.
interesting points: The object had a straight path and faded out.
The sighting occurred at night on April 11, 1952.
The observer was from the Philco Corporation Electronics Branch in Ardmore, Pennsylvania.
Weather conditions included northwest winds at 12 knots and scattered clouds.
The sighting was considered 'probably not reportable' by the investigators.
sighted object: a round, pink-reddish orange object described as a 'large ball of flame'
witnesses: 1 witness from Philco Corporation Electronics Branch
